data.question: What is the molecular mass range of the soluble recombinant spider silk proteins produced?
What method was used to spin fibers from the soluble recombinant spider silk protein?
What are the toughness and modulus values of the spun fibers compared to?
What conditions are necessary to achieve improved mechanical properties of the spun fibers?
data.answer: Dope solutions with rc-silk protein concentrations greater than 20% and postspinning draw

data.question: How does the fiber diameter affect the properties of the spun fibers?
data.answer: Fiber properties correlate with finer fiber diameter and increased birefringence

data.question: Are the spun fibers from recombinant spider silk protein water soluble?
data.answer: No, the spun fibers are water insoluble

data.question: Is the tenacity of the spun fibers higher than that of native dragline silks?
Can the recombinant spider silk proteins be produced in mammalian cells?
Is the process of spider silk production replicated exactly in mammalian cells?
Do the spun fibers have a diameter range of 10 to 40 micrometers?
Are the mechanical properties of the spun fibers identical to those of native dragline silks?
Is the strength of native dragline silk comparable to that of synthetic high-performance fibers?
What is the role of dragline silk in spiders?
data.answer: Used as the safety line and as the frame thread of the spiderâ€™s web

data.question: What is the significance of the molecular mass of the recombinant spider silk proteins?
data.answer: It indicates the size and possibly the complexity of the proteins produced

data.question: What does the term 'biomimic' imply in the context of producing spider silk in mammalian cells?
data.answer: It implies replicating the natural process of spider silk production in a different biological system

data.question: What is the impact of postspinning draw on the spun fibers?
data.answer: It is necessary for achieving improved mechanical properties of the spun fibers

data.question: Does the process of wet spinning involve high temperatures?
Are all recombinant spider silk proteins produced with the same molecular mass?
Is the production of recombinant spider silk proteins limited to a specific spider species?
What determines the mechanical properties of the spun fibers?
data.answer: The concentration of rc-silk protein in the dope solutions, postspinning draw, and the fiber diameter
